text:
<@U6GNQ7JBU> Got an answer on the community hub from `lscanlan`…
Don’t know how to fix.
I’m getting this error only within this file, and since 2 days as I’m using this code (for the api) since 2 month at least.

Thx for the support
moving this here so it gets seen by relevant people

Is there a way to get submissions to differentiate between the A and B test on an API form? I have this in my form now:
```
"context": {
            "hutk": window.getCookie("HubSpotutk"), // include this parameter and set it to the HubSpotutk cookie value to enable cookie tracking on your submission
            "pageUri": "<http://www.somesite.com.com/signup|www.somesite.com.com/signup>",
            "pageName": "Sign Up",
            "pageId": "7345214569"
          }
```
But all form submissions are being counted toward the A test.
^ any insight here would be greatly appreciated, I can’t seem to find anything in the forums.
Friendly note - today is the Platform Partner Day even at HubSpot ... most of the HubSpotters will be MIA today.
They’re gonna get my sippy cup

In case anyone was wondering, you can’t differentiate API forms in A/B testing but you can change that “pageName” property to “Sign Up A” on one module and “Sign Up B” on another then just do a hand count in the form submission page. It’s kind of a bummer but at least it’s possible!
